Description: A hollow terracotta head broken from a figure of an unidentified empress, the hair swept up behind and forward, with a roll in front, the so-called Scheitelzopffrisure, and a jewelled diadem. Modelled front and back. Two-piece mould. Light-brown marl clay, with a darker surface.
Curator's comments: Terracotta IV Purchased: Greville J. Chester. Acquired at Medinet el-Fayum (Ptolemais Euergetis). Roman, late third or fourth century AD. Comparanda: Near: Dunand 1979: no. 106 (a complete figure: no diadem, but much jewellery); Petrie 1905: pl. xlix:75 (head only, back view), probably from Herakleopolis Magna; Petrie et al. 1910: pl. xliv:171 (head only, no diadem), purchased at Memphis (Petrie Museum uc48150); Schwartz and Wild 1950: pl. xxii:15, from Dionysias (head only: no diadem). Those without a diadem are not certainly from an empress figure, but show wealthy women, possibly aristocrats. For the hairstyle, see Ziegler 2000.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3512)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
